importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news report indicates the timing of the public disclosure of Doug Martin's death and the official statements by authorities, including the Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe of the incident (early Saturday) and the time of the report (5:46 PM EDT on October 20) reflects the sequence of events, from arrest to death and public reporting, highlighting the urgency and sensitivity of the situation.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police during a detention related to a home break-in in Oakland.
Martin, a former first-round draft pick with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was 36 years old at the time of his death and had a distinguished career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest, but did not provide further details about the nature of the incident or the break-in.
An autopsy has been ordered to determine the cause of death, which has not yet been released.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history and was selected for the Pro Bowl twice during his career.
The incident has prompted public mourning, with statements from the city's mayor, the Buccaneers organization, and Martin’s family, emphasizing the impact of his life and career.
The case raises broader concerns about police conduct, use of force, and the safety of individuals during arrests, especially those with public profiles.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a former first-round draft pick with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and a Pro Bowl selection, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland police during a detention related to a home break-in. The Oakland Police Department reported the incident, and a coroner’s autopsy is pending to determine the cause of death. Martin, known for his 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons, was celebrated as one of the franchise’s top players. The incident has prompted public mourning from city officials, the Buccaneers, and his family, raising concerns about law enforcement practices and the safety of public figures during arrests.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention During Break-In Investigation
